subject: Watchdog timeout support in SBE boot window
commitMessage:
Watchdog timeout support in SBE boot window

Added support to handle SBE boot failure when watchdog
times out in the SBE boot window. FFDC information from SBE
is captured using libphal provided API, and the SBE specific
PEL for a valid FFDC is created. In case the error is related
to SBE timeout or no FFDC data then SBE dump to capture additional
debug data is initiated.

Tested: verified PEL log
root@p10bmc:~# peltool -l
{
    "0x50000332": {
        "SRC":                  "BD123504",
        "Message":              "timeout reported during SBE boot
process",
        "PLID":                 "0x50000332",
        "CreatorID":            "BMC",
        "Subsystem":            "Processor Chip Cache",
        "Commit Time":          "10/04/2021 18:25:27",
        "Sev":                  "Unrecoverable Error",
        "CompID":               "0x3500"
    }
}

- Verified SBE dump was collected
  Steps used:
  1. obmcutil poweroff
  2. istep -s0
  3. systemctl start org.open_power.Dump.Manager.service
  4. systemctl start openpower-debug-collector-watchdog@0.service
  5. Check journal log to see SBE dump requested, dump entry created
     and the dump is completed
     journalctl -f -t watchdog_timeout
  6. Verify the SBE dump:
     ls /var/lib/phosphor-debug-collector/sbedump/<dump-entry-id>

- Verified Hostboot dump was collected
  Steps Used:
  1. obmcutil poweroff
  2. istep -s0..6
  3. systemctl start org.open_power.Dump.Manager.service
  4. systemctl start openpower-debug-collector-watchdog@0.service
  5. Check journal log to see Hostboot dump requested, dump entry
     created and the dump is completed
     journalctl -f -t watchdog_timeout
  6. Verify the SBE dump:
     ls /var/lib/phosphor-debug-collector/hostbootdump/<dump-entry-id>

Signed-off-by: Shantappa Teekappanavar <sbteeks@yahoo.com>
Change-Id: Ibfe7cc6619cd99f303c6106e617bc636632d0940

WatchdogTimeout error seems more reasonable, so using this. If not, would like to know the generic error/event type to be used.

Build flag name chnaged changed to WATCHDOG_xxx?

Not sure I get the question here. It was HOSTBOOT_DUMP_COLLECTION to control whether to build in code that will generate hostboot dump (using phal) on a watchdog timeout. Now he's added SBE to the compile flag since it will now generate SBE or Hostboot dump.

This is confusing. New watchdog app is developed based on PHAL features supportde systems. right? like in the non-phal based systems , using the existing watchdog app?
That is the one reason requested toi use generic build flag name . like old vs new one.
Using WATCHDOG_DUMP_COLLECTION flag... Hope this is OK. If not, please provide the string to be used!
Can throw exception
phal library will be used. Deleted this function
I see this unitId added for the call of a SBE dump but seems like it's not set anywhere? What's it for?

set in watchdog_main.cpp:L98
DumpParameters dumpParameters = {pelId, index, DumpType::SBE};

I believe it is a chip position (index), used as failing unit id.

Now initializing explicitly...
Add timeout parameter here , that wiill simplify
This function trigger dump only if there is no FFDC info . Change name to Handle SBE failure?
Lets put some info logs in here (and in next else block). Watchdog timeouts are rare so no need to worry about filling journal. It will be useful to know which path we are taking.
Done
Init to nullptr and then line 60 is not needed. Inefficient to set it to nullptr every time until you find primary.
LIne 60 is required , procTarget is updated with processor target in each iteration. . seting nullPtr to indicate not found primary proc.
Now using phal API to get procTarget; no longer valid...
This can throw an exception. Not sure if we want to catch. May depend on whether we want to try and continue on error paths (assuming hostboot dump)
phal library used, comment not valid any more

Jayanth, if we have a situation where all processors are guarded/deconfigured or some other error path here. Would it be better to just try and get a hostboot dump in this error path? We didn't need a primary proc for that before right? I'm worried the times we need dumps the most is when we're going to have issues finding the primary proc.
Correct , libphal api already handle this.
I'm assuming I've nothing here for me to address...

Unless we want this service to be restarted, and all this tried again, best to just return a success. We've logged the error, there's nothing else to do. We don't want to hang up the power off and generate multiple errors.

Fixed code as per this comment...

@jayanth Is "org.open_power.Processor.Error.SbeBootTimeout" an appropriate/valid event name for "No FFDC data?"
sorry, i was wrong. need this .
Added it back...
update log message with meaningful message , "  another collection in progress, skipping  dump collection"
Ack
this should be dump specific timeout?
Yes, it is for requestDump timeout in case the progress status remains in 'InProgress".
the value seems to be high 25 minutes , usually sbe dump takes less than minute.

This timeout value is for both SBE dump and Hostboot dump, and can be passed as command line argument. Per @Dhruv the max timeout value is 20 minutes for Hostboot dump collection. I added another 5 minutes to it to be safe. If SBE dump takes less than a minute, it will come out immediately after the dump is collected - doesn't wait 25 minutes for every collection. So, I don't see it as a problem in general unless something really went bad and the status did not change in which case it waits for 25 minutes.

If you want me to add hardcoded value for SBE specific dump, I can do that. Just let me know how long it should wait for SBE dump collection. 

I prefer to leave it the way it is now, but open make the change...

@andrewg can comment on this , for me looks like this can impact overall ipl time , for sbe failure scenario. The timeout usally happens, due to issue with dump application crashs. I prefer to have shorter timeout for sbe dump collection case.

I prefer big timeouts vs. constantly increasing them as new use cases and new dump content is added. Is there a better number that accounts for all of that Jayanth on SBE dumps? I don't really mind the IPL hang because we've already hit 2 failures, an SBE fail, and a failure collecting the SBE dump.
